intro: Farsetia mutabilis, commonly known as the variable farsetia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its succulent characteristics and adaptations to arid environments. The plant produces vibrant, showy flowers that change color as they mature, typically from yellow to orange or red. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique color-changing blooms, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
